events.name: Green economy as a new boom of lithium extractivism
events.wd_label: Green economy as a new boom of lithium extractivism
events.wd_description: As mentioned above, lithium demand for the manufacture of rechargeable batteries doubled in less than ten years (USGS, 2012, 2016, 2020), a process directly related to carbon mitigation policies (c.f. Gobel, 2013; Fornillo, 2019; Observatorio Plurinacional de Salares Andinos, 2021).
events.description: As mentioned above, lithium demand for the manufacture of rechargeable batteries doubled in less than ten years (USGS, 2012, 2016, 2020), a process directly related to carbon mitigation policies (c.f. Gobel, 2013; Fornillo, 2019; Observatorio Plurinacional de Salares Andinos, 2021).

events.name: new colonial inequality
events.wd_description: As “a low-carbon future points to a more intensive demand for minerals, which would definitely have an effect on developing countries, rich in these resources” (La Porta, 2019, p. 28).
events.description: As “a low-carbon future points to a more intensive demand for minerals, which would definitely have an effect on developing countries, rich in these resources” (La Porta, 2019, p. 28).

events.name: boom of lithium extractivism
events.wd_description: This boom has triggered new eco-colonial rhetoric such as “Green Mining,” “Climate Smart Mining,” even “Mining for a low carbon future” (CEPAL, 2019).

relations.wd_description: qualifies something (inception or end of a thing, event, or date) as happening previously to another thing
